example_rubric.question: Explain why it is difficult to classify viruses as living organisms.

levels.description: Clearly explains that viruses exhibit some characteristics of living organisms, such as reproduction and evolution, but only within a host cell. Justifies that because viruses cannot independently carry out metabolism or reproduce outside a host, it is difficult to classify them as truly living.
Explains that viruses show characteristics of living things but does not fully clarify why this makes classification difficult or omits detail about the dependence on a host cell.
Describes some characteristics viruses share with living organisms but lacks explanation on the challenges of classification or the importance of host dependence.
Does not mention relevant characteristics of viruses or fails to explain why classifying them as living organisms is difficult.
